solution_line_template: One-third of the classrooms have 30 desks, so there are {fraction_with_30_desks} * {total_classrooms} = <<{fraction_with_30_desks}*{total_classrooms}={classrooms_with_30_desks}>>{classrooms_with_30_desks} classrooms like that.

The rest, which means {total_classrooms} - {classrooms_with_30_desks} = <<{total_classrooms}-{classrooms_with_30_desks}={classrooms_with_25_desks}>>{classrooms_with_25_desks} classrooms, have 25 desks.

One-third of the classrooms can fit {classrooms_with_30_desks} * {desks_in_30_desk_classrooms} = <<{classrooms_with_30_desks}*{desks_in_30_desk_classrooms}={students_from_30_desk_classrooms}>>{students_from_30_desk_classrooms} students.

So in total, the school can be filled with {students_from_30_desk_classrooms} + {students_from_25_desk_classrooms} = <<{students_from_30_desk_classrooms}+{students_from_25_desk_classrooms}={total_students_accommodated}>>{total_students_accommodated} students.
